headline: Why Oracle is this analyst's top 2026 software stock pick
summary: Oracle (ORCL) stock had a volatile 2025, recently seeing a sharp sell-off from record highs. Despite Oracle's turbulence, Guggenheim Securities senior research analyst and senior managing director of software, John DiFucci, names Oracle as his top software stock pick of 2026. Watch the video above to hear why. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Oracle and OpenAI Win Michigan Approval to Power New Data Center
summary: DTE had asked regulators for expedited approval of its plan to power the multi-billion dollar, 1.4-gigawatt facility in Saline Township.  Each of the regulators said on Thursday the proposed contracts between the utility and tech firms protected the power grid and regular people.  “They show a net financial benefit to DTE’s other customers,” said Dan Scripps, chair of the Michigan Public Service Commission.

headline: What it takes to construct an AI data center, Hut 8 CEO outlines
summary: Hut 8 Corp. (HUT) unveiled its own partnership with Anthropic (ANTH.PVT) and Fluidstack to build an AI data center in Louisiana. Alphabet's Google (GOOG, GOOGL) is providing the backstop on this latter deal. Hut 8 CEO Asher Genoot joins Yahoo Finance executive editor Brian Sozzi to further discuss the logistics behind constructing the data center, designing the systems inside the facility, and Google's credit history that ultimately enabled this deal. Also watch Asher Genoot explain some of the details of the data center deal and Google's invaluable role in securing it. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Data Center Capex Up 59 Percent on Continued AI Investment in 3Q 2025, According to Dell'Oro Group
summary: According to a recently published report by Dell'Oro Group, the trusted source for market information about the telecommunications, security, networks, and data center industries, worldwide data center capital expenditures increased 59 percent year-over-year, marking the eighth consecutive quarter of double-digit growth as the AI investment cycle continues to broaden beyond early, training-focused deployments.

headline: U.S. Tech Stocks Rebound Premarket After Heavy Selloff
summary: Shares in U.S. tech stocks recovered slightly premarket after a heavy selloff in the prior session. Oracle climbed 1% premarket, having dropped 5.4% to a six-month low Wednesday. Broadcom stock is also on the rise after shedding roughly $422 billion of its market cap over the last five trading days.
